venue.name: Hamlin School / South Portland Planning Dept Building

item.description:
Join the Community Garden Collective for a very exciting workshop and community building event in South Portland.  From 8:30 to 10:00 a.m. we will have a No-Dig, Weed-Free Garden Building Workshop with Lisa Fernandes of Portland Maine Permaculture.  At 10:00 a.m. we head outside to put our new knowledge to work at help create the raised beds (frames already installed!) for South Portland's new Community Garden at the Hamlin School (corner of Sawyer & Rte 77).

Attendees will learn about the permaculture approach to soil building, fertility and growing nutrient-dense food as well as helping make a huge contribution to local food security and resilience with this new garden.  Take your knowledge home and build your no-dig beds now and they'll be ready to plant right away in the Spring!

There is no cost to attend but space is limited (so please take your RSVP seriously!).  Coffee/tea/am snacks provided along with handouts to take home.  

What to bring: A notebook & camera to document the method if you like, a potluck dish to share for lunch, your own potluck kit (plate/bowl/cup/utensils/napkin) so that we can have a zero waste event, a water bottle, work gloves and clothes that can get a bit dirty.  Please dress in layers for the weather.

8:15 Arrive, get parked & settled, coffee/tea

8:30 Workshop starts inside

10:00 Break and Move outside, break into teams

10:15 to 12:30 Hand-on Practice with Sheet Mulching / No-Dig Garden Building

12:30 Share Potluck Lunch

1:00 pm Continue building for those who can stay!

3:00 pm Break for the Day!
